<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Option Exercises and Stock Vested</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>During Fiscal 2011 ended 6/30/2011, there were exercises of 40,000 stock options, grants of 390,000 stock options, and the Company made no stock awards.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Michael Huddy, President/CEO; Written Management Agreement</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Michael Huddy provides his services pursuant to a management agreement dated 2/13/1993; the terms of the agreement have been revised although no new formal agreement has been signed. &nbsp;The current terms require that Mr. Huddy provide full-time service to Barrier in an executive capacity (CEO) and to be fully responsible for Barrier&#146;s activities in the USA. &nbsp;The original agreement was for a term of four years but was to renew automatically ever two years unless written notice of the intent to terminate was given by either party to the other. &nbsp;Terms of compensation are to be given prior to any renewal period.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The employment agreement specifies employer termination provisions including: material breach of any provision of the contract; inability to perform the duties under the agreement; fraud or serious neglect or misconduct; personal bankruptcy.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The duties are complete as to those of a Chief Executive Officer (President) and include: Administration of the day to day affairs of the Employer Development of Financial, manufacturing, and marketing plans; Communication with Employer and Shareholders on a timely basis; and, Formulation and execution of a proposed budget approved by the Employer. &nbsp;The Employment Agreement contains a Confidentiality Provision that precludes the sharing of confidential information to third parties not requiring the information to conduct business with Barrier. &nbsp;The confidentiality provision extends beyond the time limit of the agreement until the information or knowledge becomes part of the public domain.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Change of Control Remuneration</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The Company has no plans or arrangements in respect of remuneration received or that may be received by Executive Officers of the Company in Fiscal 2011 to compensate such officers in the event of termination of employment (as a result of resignation, retirement, change of control) or a change of responsibilities following a change of control, where the value of such compensation exceeds $100,000 per Executive Officer.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Other Compensation</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>No Executive Officer/Director received &#147;other compensation&#148; in excess of the lesser of $25,000 or 10% of such officer's cash compensation, and all Executive Officers/Directors as a group did not receive other compensation which exceeded $25,000 times the number of persons in the group or 10% of the compensation.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Bonus/Profit Sharing/Non-Cash Compensation</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Except for the stock option program discussed in ITEM #6.E., the Company has no material bonus or profit sharing plans pursuant to which cash or non-cash compensation is or may be paid to the Company's Directors or Executive Officers.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Pension/Retirement Benefits</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>No funds were set aside or accrued by the Company during Fiscal 2011 to provide pension, retirement or similar benefits for Directors or Executive Officers.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>

</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; border-right:1px solid #000000; border-bottom:1px solid #000000" valign=bottom width=149.333><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=right>CDN$0.12</P>

</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The Company has adopted a rolling stock option plan (&#147;the 2005 Rolling Plan&#148;). &nbsp;The 2005 Rolling Plan provides for the granting of stock options to selected directors, officers, employees or consultants in an aggregate amount of up to 10% of the issued and outstanding common shares of the Company. &nbsp;Under the 2005 Rolling Plan, the granting of stock options, exercise prices and terms are determined by the Company's Board of Directors. Options granted to non-executive employees and consultants typically vest in stages over various periods of time while options granted to Directors and executive employees vest immediately upon their grant. The exercise price shall not be less than the Discounted Market Price, which is defined as the last closing price of the common shares before the date of the grant less an applicable discount, as allowed by the regulatory authorities. Options granted under the 2005 Rolling Plan may not exceed a term of 5 years unless the Company achieves classification as a &#147;Tier 1&#148; issuer in accordance with the policies of the TSX, in which case, the options may be granted for a maximum term of 10 years.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center>58</P>

<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-57.6px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;429,772 shares/options (above) held indirectly through Corcoran</P>

<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-19.2px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;beneficial interest and does not have voting or disposition control.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">(4) 800,000 represent currently exercisable stock options.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-19.2px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;429,772 shares/options (above) held indirectly through Continental Appraisal Ltd., a </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-19.2px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;private company controlled by Mr. Yates.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6,115 shares are escrowed and contingently cancelable where release is controlled by </P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Canadian regulatory authorities</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-28.8px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excludes 1,751,551 shares owned by family members, where he disavows beneficial interest </P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-28.8px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and does not have voting or disposition control.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">(5) Included are 400,000 currently exercisable warrants and 800,000 currently exercisable stock </P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;options. &nbsp;Excludes 600,000 shares owned by family members, where he disavows beneficial interest</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and does not have voting or disposition control.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-9.6px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman; font-size:8pt"># Based on 44,454,926 shares outstanding as of 8/31/2011.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>______________________________________________________________________________</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>______________________________________________________________________________</U></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=top width=657.6><P style="margin:0px; padding:0px">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center>59</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><B><U>Escrowed Common Shares</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>On 5/15/1987, the Company issued 296,500 shares of &#147;Principal Escrow&#148;&nbsp;common stock at CDN$0.01 per share. &nbsp;Effective 11/24/2004, 124,530 of these shares were cancelled and returned to the treasury. &nbsp;48,922 of these shares are still escrowed and outstanding. &nbsp;On 8/31/2011, these are held:</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Continental Appraisals Ltd.................................... &nbsp;&nbsp;6,115 shares</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Corcoran Enterprises Ltd...................................... &nbsp;42,807 shares</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Pursuant to a performance escrow agreement dated 2/24/1992 between the Company and certain escrow Shareholders (the &#147;Escrow Agreement&#148;), 48,922 common shares of the Company (the &#147;Escrow Shares&#148;) are held in escrow with Pacific Corporate Trust Company of Vancouver, British Columbia. &nbsp;The Escrow Shares are held by Corcoran Enterprises Ltd. (&#147;Corcoran&#148;), a private company owned by David Corcoran, a director of the Company and Continental Appraisals Ltd. (&#147;Continental&#148;), a private company owned by Victor Yates, a director of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Pursuant to the terms of the Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares were to have been surrendered for cancellation on 2/24/2002; however, the Escrow Shares have not been cancelled. &nbsp;The Company has received acceptance in principle from the TSX Venture Exchange (&#147;TSX&#148;) to cancel the Escrow Shares not held by Officers/Director, and have the shares held by Officers/Directors reinstated and made subject to a TSX Tier 2 Surplus Escrow Agreement (the &#147;New Escrow Agreement&#148;) with a six-year time release formula (described below). &nbsp;Conversion of performance escrow shares to time release escrow shares, as contemplated, is permitted under TSX and British Columbia Securities Commission (&#147;BCSC&#148;) policies relating to escrow shares held under previous escrow regimes such as the BCSC&#146;s Local Policy Statement 3-07.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Final approval of the conversion to a time-release formula is, in the Company&#146;s case, subject to the Company obtaining shareholder approval for the reinstatement and conversion to time-release escrow and complying with all other applicable TSXV and BCSC policies related to the reinstatement and conversion.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Following approval by the Company&#146;s shareholders, the TSXV (12/9/2004), and the BCSC, the Company and the escrow shareholders entered into the New Escrow Agreement. &nbsp;Under the terms of the New Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares and will be released as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/20 of total Escrow Shares) six months from date of TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/19 of remaining Escrow Shares) 12 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/18 of remaining Escrow Shares) 18 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;5% (1/17 of remaining Escrow Shares) 24 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/8 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;30 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/7 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;36 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/6 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;42 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/5 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;48 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/4 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;54 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/3 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;60 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (1/2 of remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;66 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-134.4px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>&nbsp;10% (all remaining Escrow Shares) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;72 months from TSXV Acceptance</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>If the Company becomes a Tier 1 issuer under the policies of the TSXV prior to the expiration of the 72-month release period set out above, the release schedule set out above will be amended to comply with the applicable Tier 1 release schedule, resulting in an accelerated release of any securities remaining in escrow, with such securities being released as if the Company had originally been classified as Tier 1 issuer. &nbsp;The securities of Tier 1 issuers held under surplus security escrow agreements are released over a three-year period, with 10% of the securities being released on TSX acceptance and 15% being released every six months thereafter.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center>60</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Unless otherwise expressly permitted in the New Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares may not be sold, transferred, assigned, mortgaged or otherwise dealt with in any way. &nbsp;Pursuant to the terms of the New Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Shares may be transferred within escrow to an individual who is a director or senior officer of the Company or of a material operating subsidiary of the Company, subject to the approval of the Company&#146;s board of directors, or to a person or company that before the proposed transfer holds more than 20% of the voting rights attached to the Company&#146;s outstanding securities, or to a person or company that after the proposed transfer will hold more than 10% of the voting rights attached to the Company&#146;s outstanding securities and that has the right to elect or appoint one or more directors or senior officers of the Company or of any of its material operating subsidiaries. &nbsp;The Escrow Shares may also be pledged, mortgaged or charged to a financial institution as collateral for a loan. &nbsp;No Escrow Shares may be transferred or delivered to the financial institution for this purpose and the loan agreement must provide that the Escrow Securities will remain in escrow if the lender realizes on the security to satisfy the loan.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Pursuant to the terms of the New Escrow Agreement, upon the bankruptcy of an escrow shareholder, the Escrow Shares of that shareholder held in escrow may be transferred within escrow to the trustee in bankruptcy or other person legally entitled to such securities. &nbsp;Upon the death of an escrow shareholder, all securities of the deceased holder will be released from escrow to the deceased holder&#146;s legal representative.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Subject to certain limited exceptions, escrow shareholders retain all voting rights attached to their Escrow Shares. &nbsp;The New Escrow Agreement provides that the Escrow Shares will be cancelled if the asset, property or business in consideration of which the Escrow Shares were issued is lost or abandoned, or the operations or development of such asset, property or business is discontinued.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>At the Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting, 12/9/2004, disinterested shareholders approved an ordinary resolution authorizing the reinstatement of the Escrow Shares and the adoption of the New Escrow Agreement by the Company and the escrow shareholders. &nbsp;Disinterested shareholders for the purpose of voting on the resolution include all shareholders of the Company other than David Corcoran and Victor Yates, and their affiliates and associates. &nbsp;A total of 3,449,253 shares held by David Corcoran, Victor Yates, and their affiliates and associates, were therefore not be counted for the purpose of determining whether the required level of shareholder approval has been obtained.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><B><U>Securities authorized for issuance under equity compensation plans.</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman">&nbsp;--- No Disclosure Necessary ---</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><B><U>Stock Options</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The terms of incentive options granted by the Company are done in accordance with the rules and policies of the TSX Venture Exchange, including the number of common shares under option, the exercise price and expiry date of such options, and any amendments thereto. &nbsp;The Company adopted a formal written stock option plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) on 12/12/2003.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Such &#147;terms and conditions&#148;, including the pricing of the options, expiry and the eligibility of personnel for such stock options; and are described below.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Number of Shares Reserved</U>. &nbsp;The number of common shares that may be issued pursuant to options granted under the Plan may not exceed 10% of the issued and outstanding shares of the Company from time to time at the date of granting of options (including all options granted by the Company under the Plan).</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Maximum Term of Options</U>. &nbsp;The term of any options granted under the Plan is fixed by the Board of Directors and may not exceed five years from the date of grant, or ten years if the Company is classified as a &#147;Tier 1&#148; issuer under the policies of the TSX Venture Exchange. &nbsp;The options are non-assignable and non-transferable.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center>61</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Exercise Price</U>. &nbsp;The exercise price of options granted under the Plan is determined by the Board of Directors, provided that it is not less than the discounted market price, as that term is defined in the TSX Venture Exchange policy manual or such other minimum price as is permitted by the TSX Venture Exchange in accordance with the policies from time to time, or, if the shares are no longer listed on the TSX Venture Exchange, then such other exchange or quotation system on which the shares are listed or quoted for trading.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Reduction of Exercise Price</U>. &nbsp;The exercise price of stock options granted to insiders may not be decreased without disinterested shareholder approval, as described below.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Termination</U>. &nbsp;Any options granted pursuant to the Plan will terminate generally within 90 days of the option holder ceasing to act as a director, officer, or employee of the Company or any of its affiliates, and within generally 30 days of the option holder ceasing to act as an employee engaged in investor relations activities, unless such cessation is on account of death. &nbsp;If such cessation is on account of death, the options terminate on the first anniversary of such cessation. &nbsp;If such cessation is on account of cause, or terminated by regulatory sanction or by reason of judicial order, the options terminate immediately. &nbsp;Options that have been cancelled or that have expired without having been exercised shall continue to be issuable under the Plan. &nbsp;The Plan also provides for adjustments to outstanding options in the event of any consolidation, subdivision, conversion or exchange of Company&#146;s shares.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Administration</U>. The Plan is administered by the Board of Directors of the Company or senior officer or employee to which such authority is delegated by the Board from time to time.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><U>Board Discretion</U>. The Plan provides that, generally, the number of shares subject to each option, the exercise price, the expiry time, the extent to which such option is exercisable, including vesting schedules, and other terms and conditions relating to such options shall be determined by the Board of Directors of the Company or senior officer or employee to which such authority is delegated by the Board from time to time and in accordance with TSX Venture Exchange policies. &nbsp;The number of option grants, in any twelve-month period, may not result in the issuance to any one optionee which exceed 5% of the outstanding common shares of the Company (unless the Company is a Tier 1 issuer and has obtained the requisite disinterested shareholder approval), or the issuance to a consultant or an employee engaged in investor relations activities which exceed 2% of the outstanding common shares of the Company. &nbsp;Disinterested shareholder approval will be sought in respect of any material amendment to the Plan.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The names of the Directors/Senior Management/employees/consultants of the Company to whom outstanding stock options have been granted and the number of common shares subject to such options are set forth in the following table, as well as the total number of options outstanding.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center>62</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=center><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><B><U>Share Purchase Warrants</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>As of 8/31/2011, 15,000,000 share purchase warrants at CDN0.15 were outstanding with an expiry date of 3/15/2012.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc305670003"></A><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><B><U>ITEM 13. &nbsp;CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>David Corcoran, Administrator/CFO/Director</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Mr. Corcoran is compensated for his managerial services to the Company indirectly through Corcoran Enterprises Ltd., a private company controlled by Mr. Corcoran. &nbsp;During Fiscal 2011/2010, $50,000 and $50,000 were paid/accrued to Corcoran Enterprises Ltd., respectively.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Other than described above, there have been no transactions since 6/30/2011, or proposed transactions, which have materially affected or will materially affect the Company in which any Director, Executive Officer, or beneficial holder of more than 10% of the outstanding common stock, or any of their respective relatives, spouses, associates or affiliates has had or will have any direct or material indirect interest.</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center>63</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc305670004"></A><P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify><B><U>ITEM 14. &nbsp;PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTANT FEES AND SERVICES</U></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>Professional accounting services were rendered by BDO Dunwoody LLP for Fiscal 2011 and Fiscal 2010.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Audit Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The aggregate fees billed for professional services rendered by the Company&#146;s principal accountant for the audit of the Company&#146;s annual financial statements incurred in the fiscal years ended 6/30/2011 and 6/30/2010 were $72,822 and $74,492<B>,</B> respectively.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Audit Related Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The Company incurred no fees during fiscal years ended 6/30/2010 and 6/30/2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>Tax Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The Company incurred tax fees of $Nil and $2,392 during fiscal years ended 6/30/2011 and 6/30/2010 for professional services rendered by the Company&#146;s principal accountant for tax compliance, tax advice and tax planning.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman"><U>All Other Fees</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New,Times New Roman" align=justify>The Company incurred no other fees during the last two fiscal years for services rendered by the Company&#146;s principal accountant.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EXHIBIT 31</TITLE>
<META NAME="author" CONTENT="Barbara ">
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="02/10/2011">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt; color:#000000">
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New"><B>EXHIBIT 31.1</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center><B>Certification of Chief Executive Officer </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center><B>Pursuant to Section 302 (a) of the US Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">I, <U>Michael Huddy</U>, certify that:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New">I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left"><U>International Barrier Technology Inc.</U>;</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">3.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">4.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">c.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">d.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">5.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s Board of Directors:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">Date: October 12, 2011</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New"><U>/s/ Michael Huddy</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">Michael Huddy</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">President and Chief Executive Officer</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">(Principal Executive Officer)</P>

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EXHIBIT 31</TITLE>
<META NAME="author" CONTENT="Barbara ">
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="03/04/2009">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt; color:#000000">
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New"><B>EXHIBIT 31.2</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center><B>Certification of Chief Financial Officer </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center><B>Pursuant to Section 302 (a) of the US Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">I, <U>David Corcoran</U>, certify that:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New">I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left"><U>International Barrier Technology Inc.</U>;</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">3.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">4.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">c.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">d.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">5.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s Board of Directors:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>all significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">Date: October 12, 2011</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New"><U>/s/ David Corcoran</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">David Corcoran</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">Chief Financial Officer</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">(Principal Financial Officer)</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>
<BR></P>

<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt; color:#000000">
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New"><B>EXHIBIT 32.1</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=center><B>SECTION 1350 CERTIFICATION</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>In connection with the Annual Report of <U>International Barrier Technology Inc.</U> (the &#147;Company&#148;) on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended <U>June 30, 2011</U> as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), I, <U>Michael Huddy</U>, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the United States Code, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of my knowledge:</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:Courier New; clear:left; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:Courier New" align=justify>The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">Date: October 12, 2011</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New"><U>/s/ Michael Huddy</U></P>

<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">President and Chief Executive Officer</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:Courier New">(Principal Executive Officer)</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

	<us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef='D100701_110630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in&quot;&gt;Note 1&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Nature of Operations and Ability to Continue as a Going Concern&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in&quot;&gt;The Company develops, manufactures and markets proprietary fire resistant building materials branded as Blazeguard in the United States of America and, as well, the Company owns the exclusive U.S. and international rights to the Pyrotite fire retardant technology.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;) on a going concern basis, which assumes that the Company will continue to realize its assets and discharge its obligations and commitments in the normal course of operations. Realization values may be substantially different from carrying values as shown and these financial statements do not give effect to adjustments that would be necessary to the carrying values and classification of assets and liabilities should the Company be unable to continue as a going concern. &amp;nbsp;At June 30, 2011, the Company had not yet achieved profitable operations, had an accumulated deficit of $14,360,735 since its inception and had a working capital deficiency of $701,934, which casts substantial doubt about the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going concern. The Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going concern is dependent upon its ability to generate future profitable operations and/or to obtain the necessary financing to meet its obligations and repay its liabilities arising from normal business operations when they come due. The Company expects to fund short-term cash flow requirements with remaining cash reserves and positive operating cash flow anticipated with increasing sales volume over the next fiscal year.&lt;font lang=&quot;EN-CA&quot;&gt;While the Company is expending its best efforts to achieve the above plans, there is no assurance that any such activity will generate funds for operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:.75in&quot;&gt;The Company was incorporated under the British Columbia Company Act and is publicly traded on the TSX Venture Exchange in Canada (&amp;#147;TSX-V&amp;#148;) and the OTC Bulletin Board in the United States of America. During the years ended June 30, 2011 and June 30, 2010, the Company had assets in each of Canada and the United States of America and generated sales primarily in the United States of America. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:-0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in&quot;&gt;Note 2&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in&quot;&gt;The preparation of financial statements in accordance with United States generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses in the reporting period. The Company regularly evaluates estimates and assumptions related to deferred income tax asset valuations, asset impairment, derivative liability, stock based compensation and loss contingencies. The Company bases its estimates and assumptions on current facts, historical experience and various other factors that it believes to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities and the accrual of costs and expenses that are not readily apparent from other sources. The actual results experienced by the Company may differ materially and adversely from the Company&amp;#146;s estimates. To the extent there are material differences between the estimates and the actual results, future results of operations will be affected.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in&quot;&gt;The financial statements have, in management&amp;#146;s opinion, been properly prepared within the framework of the significant accounting policies summarized below:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in&quot;&gt;a)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;These consolidated financial statements include the accounts of International Barrier Technology Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries, Pyrotite Coatings of Canada Inc., a Canadian company and Barrier Technology Corporation, a US company.&amp;nbsp; All inter-company transactions and balances have been eliminated.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:1.0in 1.25in&quot;&gt;b)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;Cash and cash equivalents consist of cash and short-term term deposits, with original maturity dates of less than 90 days and/or with original maturity dates over 90 days but redeemable on demand without penalty.&amp;nbsp; The Company places its cash with institutions of high-credit worthiness.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:90.25pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in&quot;&gt;c)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Inventory&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;Inventory is valued by management at the lower of FIFO (first-in, first-out) and net realizable value.&amp;nbsp; In addition, items such as abnormal amounts of idle facility expense, freight, handling and wasted material are recognized as current period charges rather than inventory value.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;d)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Plant and Equipment, Trademark and Technology Rights and Depreciation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;Plant and equipment and trademark and technology rights are recorded at cost.&amp;nbsp; Depreciation is provided as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div align=&quot;center&quot;&gt; &lt;table style=&quot;BORDER-COLLAPSE:collapse&quot; BORDER-RIGHT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-TOP:0in&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;Building under capital lease&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;240&quot; style=&quot;BORDER-BOTTOM:#f0f0f0; BORDER-LEFT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-BOTTOM:0in; BACKGROUND-COLOR:transparent; PADDING-LEFT:5.4pt; WIDTH:2.5in; PADDING-RIGHT:5.4pt; BORDER-TOP:#f0f0f0; BORDER-RIGHT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-TOP:0in&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;straight line over 20 years&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&quot;PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:avoid&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;269&quot; style=&quot;BORDER-BOTTOM:#f0f0f0; BORDER-LEFT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-BOTTOM:0in; BACKGROUND-COLOR:transparent; PADDING-LEFT:5.4pt; WIDTH:202.05pt; PADDING-RIGHT:5.4pt; BORDER-TOP:#f0f0f0; BORDER-RIGHT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-TOP:0in&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;Patent, trademark and technology rights&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;240&quot; style=&quot;BORDER-BOTTOM:#f0f0f0; BORDER-LEFT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-BOTTOM:0in; BACKGROUND-COLOR:transparent; PADDING-LEFT:5.4pt; WIDTH:2.5in; PADDING-RIGHT:5.4pt; BORDER-TOP:#f0f0f0; BORDER-RIGHT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-TOP:0in&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;straight line over 8 years&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;Leasehold improvements are depreciated over the shorter of the lease term or the estimated useful economic life. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in&quot;&gt;e)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in center 3.0in right 6.0in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;The Company reviews the recoverability of its long-lived assets whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of such assets may not be recoverable. The estimated future cash flows are based upon, among other things, assumptions about future operating performance, and may differ from actual cash flows. Long-lived assets evaluated for impairment are grouped with other assets to the lowest level for which identifiable cash flows are largely independent of the cash flows of other groups of assets and liabilities. If the sum of the projected undiscounted cash flows (excluding interest) is less than the carrying value of the assets, the assets will be written down to the estimated fair value in the period in which the determination is made. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in center 3.0in right 6.0in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in&quot;&gt;f)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Leases&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;Leases are classified as capital or operating leases.&amp;nbsp; A lease that transfers substantially all benefits and risks incidental to the ownership of property is classified as a capital lease.&amp;nbsp; At the inception of a capital lease, an asset and an obligation are recorded at an amount equal to the lesser of the present value of the minimum lease payments and the property&amp;#146;s fair value at the beginning of the lease.&amp;nbsp; All other leases are accounted for as operating leases wherein rental payments are expensed as incurred.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;g)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Foreign Currency Translation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;The functional currency for the Company&amp;#146;s operations is the US dollar. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in Canadian dollars are translated into U.S. dollars at the exchange rate prevailing at the end of the year.&amp;nbsp; Non-monetary assets and liabilities are translated at the exchange rate prevailing at the respective transaction dates while revenues and expenses are translated at the average exchange rate during the year.&amp;nbsp; Exchange gains and losses are recognized in the statement of operations. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;h)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Research and Development Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;Research and development costs are expensed in the year in which they are incurred.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in&quot;&gt;i)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Basic and Diluted Income (Loss) per Share &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;TEXT-DECORATION:none&quot;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;Basic net income (loss) per common share is calculated by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period.&amp;nbsp; Diluted net income (loss) per common share includes both the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period plus the potentially dilutive securities from stock options and warrants outstanding.&amp;nbsp; The number of shares potentially issuable at June 30, 2011 and 2010 upon exercise or conversion totaled 18,930,000 and 19,330,000 respectively.&amp;nbsp; Of the total, 15,000,000 warrants and Nil share purchase options (2010: 15,000,000 warrants and 4,330,000 share purchase options) were excluded from the calculation of diluted earnings per share because their effect is anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 0.75in&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;TEXT-DECORATION:none&quot;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;j)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; &lt;u&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.25in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in&quot;&gt;The book value of cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, and accounts payable and accrued liabilities approximate their fair values due to the immediate or short-term maturity of those instruments. Based on borrowing rates currently available to the Company under similar terms, the book value of long term debt and capital lease obligations approximate their fair values.&lt;b&gt; &lt;/b&gt;&amp;nbsp;The fair value hierarchy under GAAP is based on three levels of inputs, of which the first two are considered observable and the last unobservable, that may be used to measure fair value which are the following:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:-1in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:-49.5pt; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 121.5pt; tab-stops:121.5pt&quot;&gt;Level 1- &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:-49.5pt; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 121.5pt; tab-stops:112.5pt 121.5pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:-49.5pt; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 121.5pt; tab-stops:99.0pt 121.5pt&quot;&gt;Level 2 -&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp; observable inputs other than Level I, quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets and liabilities in markets that are not active, and model-derived prices whose inputs are observable or whose significant value drivers are observable; and &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:-49.5pt; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 121.5pt; tab-stops:99.0pt 121.5pt&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:-49.5pt; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 121.5pt; tab-stops:99.0pt 121.5pt&quot;&gt;Level 3 - &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; assets and liabilities whose significant value drivers are unobservable by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the assets or liabilities.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:.75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in; tab-stops:45.0pt 1.0in&quot;&gt;The Company had certain liabilities required to be recorded at fair value on a recurring basis in accordance with generally accepted accounting June 30, 2011 and 2010 were Level 3 liabilities.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in; tab-stops:45.0pt 1.0in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt 1in; tab-stops:45.0pt 1.0in&quot;&gt;As at June 30, 2011, the Company&amp;#146;s Level 3 liabilities consisted of the warrants issued in connection with the Company&amp;#146;s offering of equity units in a private placement (Note 6) as well as the transfer in and issuance of share purchase options granted to non-employees during the year (Note 9). The resulting Level 3 liabilities have no active market and are required to be measured at their fair value each reporting period based on information that is unobservable. A summary of the Company&amp;#146;s Level 3 liabilities for the years ended June 31, 2011 and 2010 is as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;TEXT-DECORATION:none&quot;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-INDENT:0.75in; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt; tab-stops:1.0in&quot;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Warrants&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;div align=&quot;center&quot;&gt; &lt;table width=&quot;494&quot; style=&quot;MARGIN:auto auto auto 4.65pt; WIDTH:370.3pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE:collapse&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot;&gt; BACKGROUND-COLOR:transparent; PADDING-LEFT:5.4pt; WIDTH:79.6pt; PADDING-RIGHT:5.4pt; HEIGHT:12.75pt; BORDER-TOP:#f0f0f0; BORDER-RIGHT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-TOP:0in&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot;&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN:right; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot; align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;107&quot; style=&quot;BORDER-BOTTOM:#f0f0f0; BORDER-LEFT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-BOTTOM:0in; BACKGROUND-COLOR:transparent; PADDING-LEFT:5.4pt; WIDTH:80.3pt; PADDING-RIGHT:5.4pt; HEIGHT:12.75pt; BORDER-TOP:#f0f0f0; BORDER-RIGHT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-TOP:0in&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot;&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN:right; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot; align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr style=&quot;PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:avoid; HEIGHT:12.75pt&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;281&quot; style=&quot;BORDER-BOTTOM:#f0f0f0; &lt;td width=&quot;106&quot; style=&quot;BORDER-BOTTOM:windowtext 1pt solid; BORDER-LEFT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-BOTTOM:0in; BACKGROUND-COLOR:transparent; PADDING-LEFT:5.4pt; WIDTH:79.6pt; PADDING-RIGHT:5.4pt; HEIGHT:12.75pt; BORDER-TOP:windowtext 1pt solid; BORDER-RIGHT:#f0f0f0; PADDING-TOP:0in&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot;&gt; &lt;p style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN:right; MARGIN:0in 0in 0pt&quot; align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;$&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;
